attributes.action: Greater taxation on the tabloid press for mis informing the population on Brexit
attributes.background: It is the tabloid press that have been responsible for mis informing the public regarding Brexit.  Their xenophobic views are polluting the minds of the majority of the population. The economy will suffer as a result of this, therefore this is a way of supporting the British economy
attributes.additional_details: Their continued barracking of the England team selection, resulted in the wrong team being selected by Roy Hodgson.  This was the sole reason England failed to beat Iceland.  Evidence is the bilge they have printed for the last 6 months, which is resulting in minorities of the population being targeted across the country.  Reference all the Murdoch press and other tabloid toilet paper

attributes.action: Raise the speed limit for vans below 7.5ton to the same as cars on a A road
attributes.background:
I've been a van driver for as long as I can remember.
And it just seems mad that a van has to do 50mph on a A road .
When vans this day and age are more safer  than most car's.
Cause more accidents as cars can do 60mph and get impatient and do dangerous overtaking.

attributes.action: Make it so petition makers can represent their issue and argument in parliament.
attributes.background: Are you tired of an issue being raised through a petition, only for it to be raised in parliament and the issue not solved. I feel that we should have a chance to voice our issues and make our argument heard, not only through writing, but as people and actually get a resolution to the problem.

attributes.action: Vote under the Fixed-term Parliaments Act for a general election in 2018.
attributes.background: We will soon begin exit negotiations with the EU. It is essential that the British people be given a chance to vote on Brexit again, on an informed basis, once the terms of exit are known. In the referendum, we had to vote on the basis of contradictory predictions by the Leave and Remain campaigns.
attributes.additional_details:
Under the Fixed-term Parliaments Act, an election can only be held before May 2020 if a vote of No Confidence in the government is passed or if at least 434 MPs vote for an early election. The decision no longer rests with the Prime Minister.
The EU Article 50 process cannot, in theory, be stopped once it has begun. However, in political terms, if the UK elected a government committed to remaining in the EU, it is highly probable that the EU would find a way to secure its continued membership.

attributes.action: Defer any action to leave European Union for three year or until next Election.
attributes.background: Britain has just voted to leave European Union. The process will not start until notice under article 50 is given to EU. Britain should take its own time before giving such notice and in the meanwhile try to obtain reforms such as on immigration and benefits before starting the leave process.
attributes.additional_details: EU wants Britain to leave quickly and want to make this process as a difficult divorce. Britain does not need to rush and should take time before even tendering the notice to leave and making efforts to bring reforms. This is in EU interest as well.

attributes.action: Hold a post referendum opinion poll on key factors before the exit negotiations.
attributes.background: Public opinion and information have been misrepresented in a highly complex question. Public opinion of key facts (Immigration, Economy, Politics, etc.) should be found before any exit negotiations can take place, to ensure accurate and fair representation of the true feelings of the population.
attributes.additional_details:
Evidence of misinterpretation of facts has been shown by those leading the campaigns. Public information and opinion has also been shown to be misinformed, given social media trends (i.e #Regretzit) and search engine results (i.e. What is the EU? / What are the results of leaving the EU?) taking place post the referendum result.

A full and open opinion poll should be carried out to find a better understanding of UK opinion on a wider number of topics involved in the exit debate.

attributes.action: Work Permit For Athletes Easy Accepted Aslong As Team Provides Proof Of Contact!
attributes.background: If we do not grant athletes easy workpermits then the best football league in the world will suffer. This will mean the quality of the league will drop and tourists that come over to watch the games may find alternative leagues and teams too follow which will then effect local companies

attributes.action: Ban HGV's from using both lanes on the 2 lane carriageway A1m,To stop congestion
attributes.background: There is chronic delays on the 2 carriageway A1m by HGV's overtaking HGV's forcing all traffic to 40-50 mph which leads to stood traffic at five lane ends & ferrybridge

attributes.action: Consider independent representatives in all future referendum campaigns.
attributes.background: For all future referendum campaigns, we would like to see the appointment of independent and impartial representatives debate both sides of the argument (with the budget split evenly).  We feel that by doing this, each sides argument is based on fact and not for political gain.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition has been set up in the wake of the European referendum whereby both sides of the debate contained large degrees of scaremongering and, retrospectively it would appear a number of false statements.

We feel that the clear choice in a democratic society is for independent (non-political) representatives to debate both sides in future (based on facts) and with no bias.

attributes.action: Raise maximum sentencing on those committing vile racism offences on citizens.
attributes.background: After recent events in the UK, a wave of hatred and racism has overshadowed the democracy to leave the EU. 100's of crimes of online and physical racism have been carried out particularly on EU citizens. With a new future for the country ahead, we need to stamp out this evil with increased severity.
attributes.additional_details: I can speak for the majority of people from both sides of the recent EU referendum who will condemn these vile attacks. Our country should be applauded and renowned for its diversity. Any form of racism against any citizen of any country residing in the UK should be deplored, and an increase in judicial sentencing on such crimes should be approved. Regardless of what world we live in, the UK should welcome all that arrive in this great democracy.

attributes.action: Government should give 350 UK charities 1 million each,
attributes.background: I believe in Our Country, I believe in Values and Standards. Likewise I believe in Charity.  Instead of sending 350 million per week to The EU give 350 UK Charities 1 million each.
attributes.additional_details: Have worked in Charity Shops Regularly also Donate When Able To.

attributes.action: Start talks on exiting the EU NOW
attributes.background:
The people have spoken and voted to leave the EU, David Cameron decided to quit, leaving nobody in charge. Labour MPs quitting, other MPs bickering and not listening to the people.
It's simple: we need to start the process to leave the EU NOW, not several months/years after this pointless nagging

attributes.action: British people want more funding put into: science, public services & education.
attributes.background:
We all know that our public services (e.g. NHS) are under stress, that more science means more advancement and that more education means less misinformation.
So help to try and get more funding from the British government for these areas.

attributes.action: Future referendums to be subject to a 40% of eligible voters threshold.
attributes.background: A petition to require that all future referendums which would trigger constitutional change should be subject to both an absolute majority of those voting AND a 40% of eligible voters threshold.

attributes.action: If circumstances call for a second EU referendum, voting should be compulsory.
attributes.background:
If another referendum happens but with a similar, or worse, lower turnout - what validates the second result anymore than the first result? 
Australia uses compulsory voting every general election as it delivers a strong mandate for government. 100% turnout would ensure public respect for results.
attributes.additional_details:
As there is already an £80 fine in place for failing to register on the electoral roll, an £80 for failing to turn up to vote is not much of a further stretch. 

Voters remain free to spoil ballots, or not mark a preference, as a form of protest voting - they simply have to turn up. 

We have a few months before David Cameron resigns and athe least a year or so before we REALLY leave the EU. So many have expressed regret for voting out.. the future is still salvageable, but we have to act fast.

attributes.action: Increase funding to engage those 18-24 in the voting process
attributes.background: Turnout has fallen from over 60% in the early 1990s to an average of 40% and is estimated around 36% for Brexit. More funding is needed for neutral education on the system and process.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the British Election Study, the proportion of registered 18 to 24-year-olds turning out to vote has consistently been below every other age group since the 1970s.

Eurobarometer suggested that young British adults are among the least engaged with the political process when comparing their peers across Europe.

Young people do not only vote less, but research by the Electoral Commission suggests they are less likely to be on the electoral register than other age groups.

attributes.action: To strengthen Sections 28 to 32 of the Crime and Disorder Act 1998 (Anti-Racism)
attributes.background:
The result of the EU referendum has lead to incidents of racist abuse.
UK immigrants, residents, and foreign nationals would benefit from reassurance and the strengthening of protection at this time. The government have an opportunity to strengthen the sentencing powers in relation to racial crime.
attributes.additional_details:
In addition to a heightened period of public concern, tension, and political unrest; the tenor and rhetoric of the 'Leave campaign' in relation to immigration may result in a perception and presumption that the public airing of racist comments are an acceptable expression of views.

Evidence of some racist incidents can be found here: https://www.facebook.com/sarah.leblanc.718/media_set?set=a.10101369198638985.223406919&type=3

attributes.action: Propose the EU a unified welfare system for unemployed  EU migrants.
attributes.background: European migrants, are attracted to Britain because of the generosity of its welfare system. If the EU shares common rights and laws for workers, then this should also include a common welfare system to stop the abuse of the welfare system and public resources in Britain.
attributes.additional_details: A unified welfare system would put a stop to the abuse of the British welfare system and public services from migrants, which is why so many people voted for BREXIT.

attributes.action: Have the EU referendum for 28.8% that didn't vote, teens & British residents.
attributes.background: Only a quarter (26.74%) of Britain voted to LEAVE the EU. 28.8% registered voters, millions who couldn't register, 16-17 year old Brits, and UK residents, have had no say. Democracy is not a privilege of the few, and the EU referendum is incomplete and invalid currently & it must be completed.

attributes.action: Create an independent cross-party & cross-industry task force to manage Brexit
attributes.background: Leaving the EU is such a big deal. There needs to be an independent body or committee tasked to re-negotiate a new deal that represents all UK citizens & UK businesses. This task force should have cross-party & industry-wide representation to ensure the re-negotiation with the EU is fair & balanced.

attributes.action: Hold a 2nd Referendum on the EU requiring all registered voters to cast a vote.
attributes.background: In the first vote only 37.44% of registered voters decided the long term future of the UK. This is not true Democracy.

attributes.action: support china's claim over the south china sea
attributes.background: China's claim over the south china sea has historic routes and china has pushed for countries to recognize its rightful claim to the south china sea. Thus far however the UK has refused to do so. The UK should recognize China's claim over it to both strengthen ties and recognize a historical claim.

attributes.action: Make voting compulsory for everyone over 16yrs and make sure its enforced.
attributes.background: I believe we should have a full and transparent view of our voting system, the voting for the EU referendum as a example why we should have a full view of every vote. 100% turn out and show a true scale of the votes so we dont have an issue with nearly half the country crying foul over non-voters
attributes.additional_details: EU Referendum - Massive outcry over voter turnout.

attributes.action: Make anyone over the age of 50 unable to vote in a Second EU Election
attributes.background:
Recently the Elderly Population of this Country has been able to Dictate over the Young Generation of this great nation.
Lets make sure that the People that are going to be affected by Brexit and other elections the most decide.
Also to make the system equal, by lowering the minimum age to 15.

attributes.action: Unite the country! An enquiry into the existing divide in the voting class
attributes.background: The UK on the 23rd June 2016 voted to leave the EU. The country had prior to, been subjected to scaremongering, distortion of facts and in general a politics filled with hate, divide and manipulation.
attributes.additional_details: In the aftermath of the vote, we awoke to a country on the verge on a breakup, with calls for a 2nd EU Referendum, a petition for the declaration of London's  independence and of course the call for a 2nd Scottish Referendum. We believe there is an urgent need for the UK Parliament to act and to prioritise the need to unite the country.We urge Parliament to examine the cause of the stark divide in society as reflected by the results of the EU Referendum by setting up a panel of enquiry.

attributes.action: Give Bristol, Cambridge and other remain areas the chance to remain in the EU
attributes.background:
Scotland and London have significantly voted to remain. As such actions are being taken to protect their democratic decision. 

Other parts of the UK have also strongly voted to remain and in any devolution options should have the option to join the parts of the UK that choose to remain in the EU
attributes.additional_details:
Scotland are securing their right to have a 2nd referendum and London has a petition going strongly.

Certain areas and cities have overwhelmingly voted to remain in the EU, including Gibraltar, Northern Ireland, Manchester, Oxford, Brighton and more. These areas should not have their British identity stripped in devolution without choosing what their new identity will be.

attributes.action: Mandate gov't to create a non partisan advisory panel for the Brexit process
attributes.background: Mandate the government to create an independent advisory body of experts (across finance, business, politics, academia etc) to support and advise on the Brexit process - to ensure the best result for the British people. Advisory Council to represent all professional spheres.
attributes.additional_details:
On June 23rd 2016, the UK voting populace voted at the EU referendum to leave the European Union - with a simple majority of approx 52%. Following this, the Prime Minister has indicated he will step aside for a Brexit government to lead the country to invoke the leaving process.
A new government will require the support and expertise of a non-political advisory body, to bring the best research and knowledge in achieving the most beneficial Brexit for the British, EU and global populations.

attributes.action: Raise the age to 18 for a child's train ticket
attributes.background: I was on the train going to Lisburn, the conductor asked me what age I was, I replied "16". He then went on to say I cannot give you a child ticket as you are 16 proceeding to give me a lecture on how it is illegal to ask for a child's ticket.Yet you are still considered a 'child' till you are 18.
attributes.additional_details: How do they expect us to get the money to pay for VERY expensive train journeys when we have just left school. We have no income, as individuals need time to get a job or go into further education - this can be very costly depending on what uni/tech you would like to attend.

attributes.action: Maximum voting age for national referendums
attributes.background:
Referendum results affect the country in the long-term. Therefore, only voters that are present for the consequences of the vote should be eligible to vote.

The undersigned propose to use a limit of 15 years less than the average life expectancy.

attributes.action: We propose union between UK and Turkey to mitigate against the impacts of Brexit
attributes.background: We the undersigned, concerned about the grave economic, social and political impacts of Britain’s imminent exit from the European Union, call on parliament to debate the potential benefits of full political and economic union between the UK and Turkey.
attributes.additional_details: Since neither country has a future within the EU, we would be Better Off Together!

attributes.action: Use the EU referendum as a basis for a 2nd renegotiation of EU membership
attributes.background:
The EU referendum was a close call, only a difference of one million or so votes separated the opinions of nearly 34 million voters.

The first set of renegotiation weren't successful in the first place, thus, try again and with the added critical mass of this historical event - get a better deal.

attributes.action: Allow Scotland to hold another referendum.
attributes.background:
Britain is currently backing a Brexit. The live results show Scotland is clearly not in favour of leaving the EU.

Due to Britain's relationship with the EU having changed since Scotland's referendum took place, it is only fair Scotland are allowed another referendum due to circumstantial changes.

attributes.action: Introduce ‘Digital Judgement’ as a CORE topic in the National Curriculum.
attributes.background: Some outcomes of the internet boom are calls to fight, extremism terrorism and hatred and hoaxes, via new social media propaganda.  These threaten our society and children. It MUST be a priority now to arm our children with 'Digital Judgement'; the skill to cope with the threat of the digital world.
attributes.additional_details: Society is easily seduced by online propaganda, drawn towards anti-social intolerant attitudes and behaviours towards the extremes making governance virtually impossible and increasing risks and costs to individuals and communities.  Being able to recognise and resist internet threats is a crucial skill, but getting increasingly harder. We MUST start NOW educating our children to become ‘critical' users of the social media they will grow up with, and which will shape our society for evermore.

attributes.action: Call For A 2nd EU Referendum If A Good EU Withdrawal Agreement Cannot Be Made
attributes.background: The United Kingdom voting to leave the European Union triggers Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty. We want to decide if we should remain part of the European Union based upon the nature of the withdrawal agreement.
attributes.additional_details:
A Brexit triggers Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty. The European Council will conclude the this withdrawal arrangement based upon a qualified majority vote. A large portion of the United Kingdom electorate were misled into believing a favourable withdrawal agreement is relatively certain. 

We believe in informed democracy. We believe that we the British people should be able to decide whether or not our country leaves the EU based upon facts that we can confirm. Not contingent truths.

attributes.action: Voting Results Transparency Through An Update of the Voting System
attributes.background: We call for an updated voting system, British people register once, when the time comes to vote they take a unique identifier with them to a local polling station where they can log onto an electronic terminal and submit their vote. The public should be able to view all the votes for transparency.
attributes.additional_details: Many will argue their anonymity will be breached through transparency, however this very anonymity has the potential to be used, to manipulate the general public to remain in a closed and unknown voting system, where the possibility of corruption of votes will remain. Transparency removes uncertainty and creates trust, a notion that perhaps will restore a small portion of much needed faith in our countries politics.

attributes.action: Remove ethics questions from science exams at all levels of education.
attributes.background: For most people ethics are easy, but for psychopaths they are often an ungraspable concept. This does not make them evil, most psychopaths are just disadvantaged and live peacefully otherwise. However, I feel it is unfair to put a minority at such a disadvantage purely because of how they were born.
attributes.additional_details: Psychopaths are a relatively large minority in the UK, which means that a significant quantity of students are completely unable to answer questions regarding ethics through no fault fo their own. I feel that this is discrimination against certain people and should be changed to give them a fair chance at an exam just like anybody else. Exams are vital to success in later life and being put at a disadvantage just because the exam board doesn't consider everyone is very unfair in my opinion.

attributes.action: Present only balanced arguments to the public for country wide referendums
attributes.background: There are so many factors that go into something like the EU referendum and so many points of view, from infinitely many sources, that facts are lost/blurred in a "shouting match" between parties attempting to court our vote with ill or misinformed information.
attributes.additional_details: Using the EU referendum as an example again, we see too many "scare tactics" presented openly as "fact" by both leave and remain campaigners. This has led to many of us being left confused and feeling like we are backing the party with the loudest voice. I think one of two things would help everyone if another situation such as this should arise; either campaigns should always be presented with for AND against points equally or an independent analyst should present one document with all FACTS.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for a vehicle Driver or Passenger  to Smoke with a Window Down !
attributes.background: Drivers & passengers that smoke with a window down hold their cigarettes outside of the vehicle with ash & smoke going into the eyes/faces of following motorcycles, bicycles etc. This can blind people in following vehicles causing accidents & fatalities. This should be made illegal on safety grounds
attributes.additional_details:
People have been blinded on several occasions by moving vehicles/cars/vans & stationary hgvs by ash blown into thier eyes. 
Drivers appear oblivious to the impact of their actions on other road users. For a driver this is also effectively 'not in control of the vehicle' driving with one hand. The main problem is the holding of a cigarette outside the vehicle where the forward motion or wind carries the ash into the eyes of other road users. The way to enforce would be to ensure no external smoke

attributes.action: All Police to be equipped with Naloxone kits to save lives
attributes.background:
Naloxone is a medication used to block the effects of opioids, especially in overdose.

I have provided a link to show how many Police Departments in America carry Naloxone and times it has saved lives. 

http://www.nchrc.org/law-enforcement/us-law-enforcement-who-carry-naloxone/

attributes.action: Category D (bus) license holders to be upgraded to class 2 license for free.
attributes.background: Due to the similar size of vehicles and weight of vehicles category D (bus) show be allowed to drive class 2 vehicles.

attributes.action: Stop motor insurers voiding innocent drivers' insurance policies
attributes.background: After a non-fault road traffic accident where my spine was injured, I received notice that my insurance was to be voided due to inadvertent (or innocent) non-disclosure of material fact.  The insurer could have checked the details for free at any time, but waited til I claimed.
attributes.additional_details:
There are multiple cases where the insurer is voiding policies after a claim is made.  My argument is that they are collecting "Golden Tickets", where they let you pay a policy until they are liable for something, so removing all risk

- They have a responsibility to check the details when it is free to do so.
- They shouldn't void insurance for trivial date mix-ups on policy, but rewrite/update instead.
- After non-fault incidents insurers shouldn't be allowed to throw the claimant to the wall.

attributes.action: Change the Childcare Act and enable childcare vouchers to be given for relatives
attributes.background: The Department For Education (DFE) allows some parents to claim free childcare for 2 years and for all 3 year olds. At the moment a relative of the child cannot claim this free childcare even if they are an approved childcare provider.
attributes.additional_details: According to the Childcare Act 2006 Childcare is deemed as care for a child that is not provided by a relative. There are many registered childminders who look after their relatives and therefore cannot claim the 15 hours free childcare. However if the child goes to a nursery where a relative works they are allowed to claim free childcare. If a childcare provider is registered and looking after a relative they should be entitled to claim for the free vouchers.

attributes.action: Suspend tolls on the M6Toll when roadworks are in place on the M6
attributes.background: M6 roadworks bring traffic chaos to millions of drivers and businesses. More works are halving the capacity and reducing speed to 40mph for 6 months.  Relieve the stress to motorists and cost to business by suspending toll fees on M6Toll during roadworks affecting J11 to J4a.

attributes.action: Allow all British Overseas Territories Citizens become full British/UK citizens
attributes.background: I am from Turks and Caicos Islands, a British overseas territory located in the Caribbean. British Overseas Territories Act 2002 did not allow  all British Overseas Territories Citizens to become full British citizen. I would like all members of parliament to review and vote on this.
attributes.additional_details: Parliament  should amend the British Nationality Act 1981 and the British Overseas Act 2002 to allow all British overseas territories become full British/UK citizens.

attributes.action: Make retesting of all road users compulsory every 5 years to ensure road safety.
attributes.background: With road deaths increased in 2014 by 4% from 2013 to 1775, serious road injuries increasing by 5% in 2014 from 2013 to 22807 and the total of 194,477 casualties of all severities in reported road traffic accidents during 2014 retesting of road users is essential to protecting the roads.
attributes.additional_details: http://tinyurl.com/nkzmbzh shows the evidence. What is proposed is that road users be charged for the retest. If they pass the test they are refunded the entire test fee as they are competent, if they fail they revert to a provisional licence and have to retrain similar to learners. This makes roads safer (priority), increases employment within the DVSA (better for workforce), provides additional income source which can be put on improving the road network in the UK. Winners all round.

attributes.action: Make all GP's open for half a day every Saturday or Sunday
attributes.background: There are so many people that can't get time off work for doctor's appointments due to their regular working weeks, example, 9-5 Monday to Friday. Opening the GP's for a couple of hours at the weekend will allow for those that struggle to arrange doctor's appointments without having to book holidays
attributes.additional_details: I work as a healthcare assistant, Monday to Friday, if i didn't turn up to work their would be vulnerable adults left at risk, but I still need to look after my own health, if I get ill so do my clients. Why should I have to book holiday to see the doctor.

attributes.action: Introduce compulsory attendance to a 'Safe Drive Stay Alive' event
attributes.background: This event is used as means of reducing the amount of accidents and road collisions. It is vital that people are aware of the minor things that can significantly impact their lives, and the lives of others. I believe it should be made mandatory before a person can officially gain their licence.
attributes.additional_details:
'Stay Drive Stay Alive' found that young drivers are much more likely to be involved in a crash on the roads, often due to inexperience and a lack of knowledge of the risks. 
*Around 1 in 4 deaths on the road is aged 17-24*
The Safe Drive Stay Alive campaign will reach new and pre-drivers in an emotive and hard-hitting way, influencing behaviour and attitude on the roads.

attributes.action: Regulate & cap the rent prices in London (RRR)
attributes.background: It's time for the government to take responsibility and stop ignoring their broken system. They should regulate and cap rent prices for rooms at the maximum of £550pcm. We want Responsibility, Regulation and Results (RRR).
attributes.additional_details:
Amongst all of the city wonders  London is known for its extremely high living costs - not to mention the extortionate prices private landlords are charging tenants. 

Due to inflation and low wages some Londoners are forced to work more than one job solely to pay the rent. 
 A lot of these landlords are illegally renting rooms and do not declare the income they are receiving from tenants and are charging tenants anything from £500-£850 for box rooms that can only fit a bed- this need to change!

attributes.action: Make Business Studies, Life Skills and Politics mandatory at Secondary School.
attributes.background: In school there is no direct focus on skills that children need to truly succeed in life. Business Studies is taken an optional subject when really we should be teaching our children how to be entrepreneurial, this would help children gain essential critical thinking skills to help them grow.
attributes.additional_details: There is so much opportunity that is potentially being wasted by not equipping children with the skills and knowledge to get on in life. Children should have a knowledge of politics, business, how to get a mortgage. Children should know who the Prime Minister of this country is and how laws are made. If we want our country to be set up for success we should invest in our children as they will invest in the country themselves.

attributes.action: Include Aesthetic Impairment or "Ugliness" in The Equality Act 2010.
attributes.background: We call for “Aesthetic Impairment” to be added to The Equality Act (2010) by the UK government and for suffers to be awarded the same protection from discrimination as the other included groups.
attributes.additional_details:
Many people whom are aesthetically Impaired or “ugly” face discrimination and disadvantage on a daily basis. Many unattractive people can be left feeling ostracised and questioning their self-worth and it can also lead to the development of mental health issues. 

Whatever the nature or route cause of someone’s appearance, not everybody can conform with the image of what our society deems to be “attractive” and to judge someone based upon this is fundamentally wrong.
